title: Wright wins UK Open title
text:
Peter 'Snakebite' Wright beats Gerwyn Price to win UK Open Scottish thrower Wright continues superb form with long-awaited TV title By Sky Sports Darts Last Updated: 05/03/17 11:19pm Peter Wright finally claimed a televised title on Sunday evening A tearful Peter 'Snakebite' Wright ended his long wait for a televised title, defeating Gerwyn Price 11-6 to win the UK Open at the Butlins Minehead Resort in Somerset. 
Wright, who was beaten by Michael van Gerwen in the final for the past two years, made it third time lucky as he lifted the trophy and took home a Â£70,000 first prize. 
The world No 3 produced some exceptional darts, not least his 110 average in a 10-8 quarter-final victory over Raymond van Barneveld. 
Wright also produced a clinical 144 checkout in moving 4-1 up as he took command of his semi-final against Daryl Gurney, which he secured with an 11-5 victory before seeing off Price in the decider. Peter Wright reflects on sensational Premier League display in Exeter 
Finishes of 110 and 104 helped Wright into an early 3-0 lead, and he extended that to 7-2 before Wright claimed four of the next five to rally and reduce the gap to 8-6. 
A key 86 checkout from Wright, however, proved crucial as he regained a three-leg cushion before he punished missed doubles from Price to lead 10-6, and an 85 finish on the bull saw him claim glory over the emerging Welsh star. 
"Fair play to Peter," said Gurney. "What separates the men from the boys was his finishing, and week-in week-out playing on TV in the Premier League like he does showed there. That's where I need to improve and that's the standard." 
Wright is the PDC's form player, having recorded the second highest televised average in history with a thrilling 7-2 defeat of Adrian Lewis in Exeter , as he joined Phil Taylor at the top of the Premier League table last Thursday. 
Coral UK Open - Sunday March 5
